title: Red Snapper with Citrus and Fennel Salad
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Red Snapper with Citrus and Fennel Salad a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 36g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 292 calories. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 4 and costs $3.4 per serving. Head to the store and pick up mint leaves, salt and pepper, olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 40 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 90%, this dish is outstanding. Try Crispy Pan Seared Florida Snapper with Passion Fruit Cream and Florida Citrus and Shaved Fennel Salad, Garnished with Sauteed Florida Gulf Shrimp and Spicy Green Mango Jam, Red Snapper, Shrimp, and Watermelon Ceviche, and Sautéed Snapper with Orange-Fennel Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Rabble Pinot Gris. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Preheat the broiler. In a large bowl, toss the radishes, fennel, bell pepper, jalapeo, cilantro, chives and mint. Using a sharp knife, peel the grapefruit and orange, removing all of the bitter white pith. Working over the bowl, cut between the membranes and release the sections into the bowl. Squeeze the membranes over the bowl. Add the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the lemon juice to the bowl and season the salad with salt and pepper.                                              Set the fish on a well-oiled, sturdy baking sheet and brush with olive oil; season with salt and pepper. Broil 6 inches from the heat for 4 minutes, on one side only, just until white throughout. Using a spatula, transfer the fish to plates. Top with the salad and serve.

steps.step: Preheat the broiler. In a large bowl, toss the radishes, fennel, bell pepper, jalapeo, cilantro, chives and mint. Using a sharp knife, peel the grapefruit and orange, removing all of the bitter white pith. Working over the bowl, cut between the membranes and release the sections into the bowl. Squeeze the membranes over the bowl.
Add the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the lemon juice to the bowl and season the salad with salt and pepper.

Set the fish on a well-oiled, sturdy baking sheet and brush with olive oil; season with salt and pepper. Broil 6 inches from the heat for 4 minutes, on one side only, just until white throughout. Using a spatula, transfer the fish to plates. Top with the salad and serve.
